content: diagonal box stitch by darlisa riggs the diagonal box stitch is an easy stitch to use but because of the flipping needed it can also be a frustrating stitch to try out this stitch can be used to create washcloths blankies afghans and blankets sizes & materials list hook s use size recommended for chosen yarn yarn select yarn based on project i e cotton for a washcloth etc select 1 color for a solid color piece select 2 or more for a striped piece tapestry needle size see preparation note below gauge not applicable preparation determine how long and wide the piece will be for example a washcloth for a baby would be 6 x6 while a blankie would be 36 x36 etc increase row row 1 chain 6 double_crochet in 4th 5th and 6th chain from hook row 1 completed row 2 chain 6 double_crochet in 4th 5th and 6th chain from hook flip row 1 slip_stitch in chain 3 space at end of row 1 page 1 of 4 chain 3 3 double_crochet in same space row 2 completed row 3 chain 6 double_crochet in 4th 5th and 6th chain from hook flip row 1 & 2 *slip_stitch in chain 3 space at end of first box of row 2 page 2 of 4 chain 3 3 double_crochet in same space * repeat from * to * for third box of row 3 row 3 completed row 4 repeat row 3 until the piece is as wide as needed note you can change colors every few row to get a striped piece just make sure you are consistent when changing colors i e every two row every three row etc decrease row once the width is as long as needed it is time to do a decrease row to make the corner you can then continue to either square off the piece or add more row to increase the length chain 1 turn piece do not flip slip_stitch in first 3 double_crochet *slip_stitch in chain 3 space chain 3 3 double_crochet in same space * page 3 of 4 repeat from * to * to end of row next row you now have two options option 1 if length of piece is as long as needed repeat decrease row until you reach the last row that has only 1 box join with slip_stitch in end chain 3 space option 2 if length of piece isn t yet long enough do an increase row then a decrease row continue alternating the increase and decrease row until the piece is long enough then continue with decrease row until you reach the last row that has only 1 box join with slip_stitch in end chain 3 space finishing crochet evenly around the edges with single_crochet for a fancier edge continue around the edge with a scalloped edging or your favorite edging for more detailed instructions with even more images check out the tutorial at crochet cabana pattern and images ©
